verses.verse: Now<WH4994> will I sing<WH7891> to my well beloved<WH3039> a song<WH7892> of my beloved<WH1730> touching his vineyard.<WH3754> My well beloved<WH3039> has a vineyard<WH3754> in a very fruitful<WH1121> <WH8081> hill:<WH7161>

And he fenced<WH5823> it, and gathered out the stones<WH5619> thereof, and planted<WH5193> it with the choicest<WH8321> vine,<WH8321> and built<WH1129> a tower<WH4026> in the middle<WH8432> of it, and also<WH1571> made<WH2672> a wine press<WH3342> therein:<WH8432> and he looked<WH6960> that it should bring<WH6213> forth<WH6213> grapes,<WH6025> and it brought<WH6213> forth<WH6213> wild<WH891> grapes.<WH891>
And now,<WH6258> O inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> and men<WH376> of Judah,<WH3063> judge,<WH8199> I pray<WH4994> you, between<WH996> me and my vineyard.<WH3754>

What<WH4100> could have been done<WH6213> more<WH5750> to my vineyard,<WH3754> that I have not done<WH6213> in it? why,<WH4069> when I looked<WH6960> that it should bring<WH6213> forth<WH6213> grapes,<WH6025> brought<WH6213> it forth<WH6213> wild<WH891> grapes?<WH891>

And now<WH6258> go to; I will tell<WH3045> you what<WH853> <WH834> I will do<WH6213> to my vineyard:<WH3754> I will take<WH5493> away<WH5493> the hedge<WH4881> thereof, and it shall be eaten<WH398> up; and break<WH6555> down the wall<WH1447> thereof, and it shall be trodden<WH4823> down:

And I will lay it waste:<WH1326> it shall not be pruned,<WH2168> nor<WH3808> dig;<WH5737> but there shall come<WH5927> up briers<WH8068> and thorns:<WH7898> I will also command<WH6680> the clouds<WH5645> that they rain<WH4305> no rain<WH4306> on it.

For the vineyard<WH3754> of the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is the house<WH1004> of Israel,<WH3478> and the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063> his pleasant<WH8191> plant:<WH5194> and he looked<WH6960> for judgment,<WH4941> but behold<WH2009> oppression;<WH4939> for righteousness,<WH6666> but behold<WH2009> a cry.<WH6818>

Woe<WH1945> to them that join<WH5060> house<WH1004> to house,<WH1004> that lay<WH7126> field<WH7704> to field,<WH7704> till<WH5704> there be no<WH657> place,<WH4725> that they may be placed<WH3427> alone<WH905> in the middle<WH7130> of the earth!<WH776>

In my ears<WH241> said the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> Of a truth<WH518> <WH3808> many<WH7227> houses<WH1004> shall be desolate,<WH8047> even great<WH1419> and fair,<WH2896> without<WH369> inhabitant.<WH3427>
Yes,<WH3588> ten<WH6235> acres<WH6776> of vineyard<WH3754> shall yield<WH6213> one<WH259> bath,<WH1324> and the seed<WH2233> of an homer<WH2563> shall yield<WH6213> an ephah.<WH374>

Woe<WH1945> to them that rise<WH7925> up early<WH7925> in the morning,<WH1242> that they may follow<WH7291> strong drink;<WH7941> that continue<WH309> until night,<WH5399> till wine<WH3196> inflame<WH1814> them!

And the harp,<WH3658> and the viol,<WH5035> the tabret,<WH8596> and pipe,<WH2485> and wine,<WH3196> are in their feasts:<WH4960> but they regard<WH5027> not the work<WH6467> of the LORD,<WH3068> neither<WH3808> consider<WH7200> the operation<WH4639> of his hands.<WH3027>

Therefore<WH3651> my people<WH5971> are gone into captivity,<WH1540> because they have no<WH1097> knowledge:<WH1847> and their honorable<WH3519> men<WH4962> are famished,<WH7458> and their multitude<WH1995> dried<WH6704> up with thirst.<WH6772>

Therefore<WH3651> hell<WH7585> has enlarged<WH7337> herself,<WH5315> and opened<WH6473> her mouth<WH6310> without<WH1097> measure:<WH2706> and their glory,<WH1926> and their multitude,<WH1995> and their pomp,<WH7588> and he that rejoices,<WH5938> shall descend<WH3381> into it.
And the mean<WH120> man<WH120> shall be brought<WH7817> down,<WH7817> and the mighty<WH376> man<WH376> shall be humbled,<WH8213> and the eyes<WH5869> of the lofty<WH1364> shall be humbled:<WH8213>
But the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> shall be exalted<WH1361> in judgment,<WH4941> and God<WH410> that is holy<WH6918> shall be sanctified<WH6942> in righteousness.<WH6666>
Then shall the lambs<WH3532> feed<WH7462> after their manner,<WH1699> and the waste<WH2723> places of the fat<WH4220> ones shall strangers<WH1481> eat.<WH398>
Woe<WH1945> to them that draw<WH4900> iniquity<WH5771> with cords<WH2256> of vanity,<WH7723> and sin<WH2402> as it were with a cart<WH5699> rope:<WH5688>

That say,<WH559> Let him make speed,<WH4116> and hasten<WH2363> his work,<WH4639> that we may see<WH7200> it: and let the counsel<WH6098> of the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel<WH3478> draw near<WH7126> and come,<WH935> that we may know<WH3045> it!

Woe<WH1945> to them that call<WH559> evil<WH7451> good,<WH2896> and good<WH2896> evil;<WH7451> that put<WH7760> darkness<WH2822> for light,<WH216> and light<WH216> for darkness;<WH2822> that put<WH7760> bitter<WH4751> for sweet,<WH4966> and sweet<WH4966> for bitter!<WH4751>
Woe<WH1945> to them that are wise<WH2450> in their own eyes,<WH5869> and prudent<WH995> in their own sight!<WH6440>
Woe<WH1945> to them that are mighty<WH1368> to drink<WH8354> wine,<WH3196> and men<WH582> of strength<WH2428> to mingle<WH4537> strong drink:<WH7941>
Which justify<WH6663> the wicked<WH7563> for reward,<WH7810> and take<WH5493> away<WH5493> the righteousness<WH6666> of the righteous<WH6662> from him!

Therefore<WH3651> as the fire<WH784> devours<WH398> the stubble,<WH7179> and the flame<WH3852> consumes<WH7503> the chaff,<WH2842> so their root<WH8328> shall be as rottenness,<WH4716> and their blossom<WH6525> shall go<WH5927> up as dust:<WH80> because<WH3588> they have cast<WH3988> away the law<WH8451> of the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> and despised<WH5006> the word<WH565> of the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel.<WH3478>

Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> is the anger<WH639> of the LORD<WH3068> kindled<WH2734> against his people,<WH5971> and he has stretched<WH5186> forth his hand<WH3027> against<WH5921> them, and has smitten<WH5221> them: and the hills<WH2022> did tremble,<WH7264> and their carcasses<WH5038> were torn<WH5478> in the middle<WH7130> of the streets.<WH2351> For all<WH3605> this<WH2063> his anger<WH639> is not turned<WH7725> away, but his hand<WH3027> is stretched<WH5186> out still.<WH5750>

And he will lift<WH5375> up an ensign<WH5251> to the nations<WH1471> from far,<WH7350> and will hiss<WH8319> to them from the end<WH7097> of the earth:<WH776> and, behold,<WH2009> they shall come<WH935> with speed<WH4120> swiftly:<WH7031>

None<WH369> shall be weary<WH5889> nor<WH3808> stumble<WH3782> among them; none<WH3808> shall slumber<WH5123> nor<WH3808> sleep;<WH3463> neither<WH3808> shall the girdle<WH232> of their loins<WH2504> be loosed,<WH6605> nor<WH3808> the lace<WH8288> of their shoes<WH5275> be broken:<WH5423>

Whose<WH834> arrows<WH2671> are sharp,<WH8150> and all<WH3605> their bows<WH7198> bent,<WH1869> their horses'<WH5483> hoofs<WH6541> shall be counted<WH2803> like flint,<WH6864> and their wheels<WH1534> like a whirlwind:<WH5492>

Their roaring<WH7581> shall be like a lion,<WH3833> they shall roar<WH7580> like young<WH3715> lions:<WH3715> yes, they shall roar,<WH5098> and lay hold<WH270> of the prey,<WH2964> and shall carry<WH6403> it away safe,<WH6403> and none<WH369> shall deliver<WH5337> it.

And in that day<WH3117> they shall roar<WH5098> against<WH5921> them like the roaring<WH5100> of the sea:<WH3220> and if one look<WH5027> to the land,<WH776> behold<WH2009> darkness<WH2822> and sorrow,<WH6862> and the light<WH216> is darkened<WH2821> in the heavens<WH6183> thereof.
